author: Baha'u'llah
source_text:
(٥١) ﴿ يَا ابْنَ الإِنْسَانِ ﴾
بَلاَئِي عِنايَتي، ظاهِرُهُ نارٌ وَنِقْمَةٌ وَباطِنُهُ نُورٌ وَرَحْمَةٌ. فاسْتَبِقْ إِلَيْهِ لِتَكُونَ نُورًا أَزَلِيًّا وَرُوحًا قِدَمِيًّا، وَهُوَ أَمْري فَاعْرِفْهُ.
translation:
(51) O SON OF MAN!
My calamity is My providence, outwardly it is fire and vengeance, but inwardly it is light and mercy. Hasten thereunto that thou mayest become an eternal light and an immortal spirit. This is My command unto thee, do thou observe it.
